title: Oceanic Challenger Series - Violation of Rules
body:
**League of Legends Competition Ruling**
 


**Team:** Krispy Kreme Crew

**Region: **Oceania

**Date of Ruling: **March 17, 2015

**Subject:  **Violation of Oceanic Challenger Series Ruleset

 

**Facts**

In tonight’s OCS games, Krispy Kreme Crew could not fill the full five men rosters before the series was scheduled to start by the time specified by Riot officials. They had not installed the tournament client on multiple members.

Teams were given full information on how to install the tournament clients, tournament schedule and tournament accounts five days before the games begin.

**Relevant Rules**

The Oceanic Challenger Series specifies:

Setup and Player Responsibilities for Online Matches

All players will be expected to be ready to join the game lobby at the time specified by the Riot officials. Readiness includes, but is not limited to, five rostered players having completed client patching, configuration of in-game settings, and completed rune and mastery pages.

**Analysis**

Krispy Kreme Crew could not get five rostered players on completed clients and be ready to join the game lobby. 

**Ruling**

Krispy Kreme Crew Violated the Oceanic Challenger Series Ruleset.

**Competition Penalties**

Krispy Kreme Crew has forfeited the games against Team Absolute
